snippet: The Republican Party of Armenia, a political party loyal to President Serge Sargsyan, won the most votes in its parliamentary election over the weekend.
abstract: Armenian political party loyal to Pres Serzh Sargsyan wins the most votes in a parliamentary election, result that tracks closely with pattern in other post-Soviet elections in which the parties in power tend to stay in power. (M)/
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- A political party in Armenia loyal to President Serzh Sargsyan won the most votes in a parliamentary election over the weekend, a result that tracked closely with a pattern in other post-Soviet elections: the parties in power tend to stay in power. The election was the first since rioting broke out in Armenia four years ago to protest the election of Mr. Sargsyan, Armenia's third president since independence. The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe criticized that election as flawed.

headline.main: Supporters of President Gain in Armenian Election
